hopobject.body:
10 Years of BeagleBoard

from the foundation
Great Teaching Ideas Can Receive a Lab of PocketBeagle® boards



Let's Educate!
We are announcing a new program as part of our continued commitment to education in the use of open-source software and hardware. Educators in schools can apply for the opportunity to receive up to 30 PocketBeagle® boards from the BeagleBoard.org® Foundation. The donation of the boards will further project development in the classroom or makerspace. To participate in this opportunity submit a project idea to our online education project form. We look forward to hearing more about your ideas for using PocketBeagle® in the classroom.

Let's Celebrate!
Are you coming to MakerFaire NYC this month? The celebration of the BeagleBoard.org® community in it's tenth year continues by highlighting Makers! Join us for a #BringAHack event in the Big Apple on Friday, September 21st at 9pm at Leaf Bar and Lounge. Register to hold your place!
Can't make it in person? Tell us about your favorite BeagleBoard.org based Hack and be featured in our newsletter. It can be your own project or someone else’s that has been memorable for you. We hope you’ll enjoy celebrating 10 years of BeagleBoard.org® with us!
—Christine Long, Executive Director
articles


Join BeagleBoard.org® at World Maker Faire, New York City, Sept 21-23, 2018
BeagleBoard.org® is excited to be a sponsor of World Maker Faire® 2018. Join us! We’ll be hosting demos and a workshop at the Education Forum on Friday, Sept 21 and in the Maker Shed on Saturday Sept 22 through Sunday Sept 23. We’ll be celebrating our 10th Anniversary with a

Read more »

10 Year Anniversary Classic Project - The Descriptive Camera
Back in 2012, this camera took the budding idea of crowdsourcing metadata about a picture to an embedded platform. With features of a regular camera it produces an image using Amazon Mechanical Turk API for a text description output of the scene.

Read more »

Educator Highlight - Steven F. Barrett, Author, Embedded Systems Educator and Beagle Lover
Dr Barrett, a prolific and inspired author of 12 texts combined his love of Beagles and Electronics when the performance and size of BeagleBone® Black sparked his creative teaching ideas. Arooooo!

Read more »

GSoC 2018 Brings Students and BeagleBoard.org® Mentors Together
Check out the GSoC 2018 projects mentored by BeagleBoard.org® this summer. Students contributed to open source code with BeagleBoot, BoneScript and BeagleBone® UI and PocketBeagle® Speak & Spell projects.

Read more »

hot off the presses

Bad to the Bone - Crafting Electronics Systems with BeagleBone Black, Second Edition

By Steven Barrett and Jason Kridner.

Now in it’s second edition, “Bad to the Bone” covers getting started with the basics of using BeagleBone® Black in a classroom, all the way to complete exercises centered on motivational, fun robot projects.

Motor Cape

Motor Cape in stock now!
Drive DC motors with direction and PWM control.
4x 3A motor outputs up to 46V

featured projects

Bela Mini - Low-Latency Audio + Sensor Cape for PocketBeagle®
Bela Mini creates interactive audio projects like musical instruments, sound installations & assistive technology.
More Details »

 

Bipolar Stepper Motor with BeagleBone® Blue
BeagleBone® Blue's DC motor drivers can be used to drive bipolar stepper motors too! Pair them up with a little code for open loop control.
More Details »

 
PocketBeagle® Automatic Light Switch
Beginner project creates an automatic light switch using a simple servo, PocketBeagle® and PIR motion sensor!
More Details »

 

Smart Mirror
Students at University of Texas built their own custom mirror with BeagleBone® Black and parts from the hardware store.
More Details »

connect with us

The BeagleBoard.org® Foundation is a US-based 501 c3 non-profit existing to provide education in and collaboration around the design and use of open-source software and hardware in embedded computing.
